items.title: Fish Cannons, Koi Herpes and Other Tools to Combat Invasive Carp
items.author: JoAnna Klein
items.description: Researchers are experimenting with a Rube Goldberg-esque mix of tactics to control hearty, nonnative swimmers that re-engineer nutrient-rich Midwest waters.
items.content: Researchers are experimenting with a Rube Goldberg-esque mix of tactics to control hearty, nonnative swimmers that re-engineer nutrient-rich Midwest waters.

items.title: Elephants May Sniff Out Quantities With Their Noses
items.author: Veronique Greenwood
items.description: Understanding how the endangered mammals smell the world could help with their conservation, researchers say.
items.content: Understanding how the endangered mammals smell the world could help with their conservation, researchers say.
categories: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences

items.title: Why Crocodiles Are Not Just Living Fossils
items.author: Asher Elbein
items.description: They’ve changed remarkably over millions of years, and at one point may even have been warmblooded.
items.content: They’ve changed remarkably over millions of years, and at one point may even have been warmblooded.

items.title: The Shorebirds of Delaware Bay Are Going Hungry
items.author: Jon Hurdle and Michelle Gustafson
items.description: On their migrations north, famished birds stop to feast on eggs laid by horseshoe crabs. But the crabs were overfished, and conservationists say that some bird species may not recover.
items.content: On their migrations north, famished birds stop to feast on eggs laid by horseshoe crabs. But the crabs were overfished, and conservationists say that some bird species may not recover.

items.title: After SpaceX Starlink Launch, a Fear of Satellites That Outnumber All Visible Stars
items.author: Shannon Hall
items.description: Images of the Starlink constellation in orbit have rattled astronomers around the world.
items.content: Images of the Starlink constellation in orbit have rattled astronomers around the world.

items.title: He Was Looking for Opals. Instead He Found a New Dinosaur Species.
items.author: Jamie Tarabay and Genevieve Jia Ling Finn
items.description: Scientists reported the discovery in Australia of a plant-eating species, 35 years after a miner brought fossils to a museum in Sydney.
items.content: Scientists reported the discovery in Australia of a plant-eating species, 35 years after a miner brought fossils to a museum in Sydney.

items.title: NASA Hires 3 Companies for Moon Science Deliveries
items.author: Kenneth Chang
items.description: The landers would be the first American spacecraft to touch down on the moon since the astronauts of Apollo 17 left in 1972.
items.content: The landers would be the first American spacecraft to touch down on the moon since the astronauts of Apollo 17 left in 1972.

items.title: These Mole Rats Felt No Pain, Even From Wasabi’s Burn
items.author: Cara Giaimo
items.description: Discovering the rodent’s imperviousness to a stinging chemical compound may lead to advancements in pain treatment for people.
items.content: Discovering the rodent’s imperviousness to a stinging chemical compound may lead to advancements in pain treatment for people.

items.title: A Signal in Giant Earthquakes That Could Save Lives
items.author: Robin George Andrews
items.description: The full power of the biggest temblors could be determined in as little as 10 to 15 seconds after they begin, a new study finds, and long before it ends.
items.content: The full power of the biggest temblors could be determined in as little as 10 to 15 seconds after they begin, a new study finds, and long before it ends.

items.title: Kids Sued the Government Over Climate Change. A Key Day in Court Has Arrived.
items.author: John Schwartz
items.description: A federal appeals court will hear a closely watched lawsuit brought by young people to compel the federal government to take action on climate change
items.content: A federal appeals court will hear a closely watched lawsuit brought by young people to compel the federal government to take action on climate change
